required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase II Dose Finding Study of RDEA3170 Versus Placebo in Japanese Patients With Gout or Asymptomatic Hyperuricemia
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Multicenter, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Group, 24-Week Phase II Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of RDEA3170 5 mg, 7.5 mg, 10 mg, 12.5 mg and 15 mg Versus Placebo and Open-Label Allopurinol 200 mg as a Reference Arm in Japanese Patients With Gout or Asymptomatic Hyperuricemia

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to examine the hypothesis that administration of RDEA3170 to Japanese patients with gout or asymptomatic hyperuricemia in doses of 5 mg, 7.5 mg, 10 mg, 12.5 mg and 15 mg once daily, respectively will result in greater reduction of sUA compared to placebo.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percent changes of serum uric acid levels from baseline levels
primary_outcome.description: The primary objective of the study is to compare percent changes of serum uric acid levels from baseline levels after 16 weeks of dosing between RDEA3170 treatment groups and the placebo treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with a serum uric acid level ≤6.0 mg/dL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 1 to 4 weeks, up to 16 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the proportion of subjects whose serum uric acid levels are ≤ 6.0 mg/dL between RDEA3170 treatment groups and the placebo treatment group at each study visit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 1 to 4 weeks, up to 16 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: To compare serum uric acid levels at each study visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute change of serum uric acid levels from baseline levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 1 to 4 weeks, up to 16 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the absolute change of serum uric acid levels from baseline levels

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent change of serum uric acid levels from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 1 to 4 weeks, up to 16 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: To compare percent change of serum uric acid levels from baseline levels

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse Events, laboratory tests, vital signs, electrocardiograms, gout flare and pain assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 1 to 4 weeks, up to 18 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of RDEA3170 in patients with gout or asymptomatic hyperuricemia

other_outcome.description: The number of subjects with gout flares will be summarized by treatment group.

other_outcome.time_frame: Every 1 to 4 weeks, up to 16 weeks
other_outcome.description: sUA-related efficacy variables (percent change in sUA level from baseline, absolute change in sUA level from baseline, sUA concentration) will be analyzed in terms of plasma RDEA3170 concentration.

other_outcome.time_frame: Every 1 to 4 weeks, up to 16 weeks
other_outcome.description: Urinary uric acid concentration, urinary pH and serum creatinine level will be analyzed in terms of plasma/urine RDEA3170 concentration.

other_outcome.measure: Percent changes of serum uric acid levels from baseline levels
other_outcome.description: To compare percent changes of serum uric acid levels from baseline levels after 24 weeks of dosing between RDEA3170 treatment groups and the placebo treatment group.

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with a serum uric acid level ≤6.0 mg/dL
other_outcome.time_frame: Every 1 to 4 weeks, up to 24 weeks
other_outcome.description: To compare the proportion of subjects whose serum uric acid levels are ≤ 6.0 mg/dL between RDEA3170 treatment groups and the placebo treatment group at each study visit.

other_outcome.time_frame: Every 1 to 4 weeks, up to 24 weeks
other_outcome.description: To compare serum uric acid levels at each study visit

other_outcome.measure: Absolute change of serum uric acid levels from baseline levels
other_outcome.time_frame: Every 1 to 4 weeks, up to 24 weeks
other_outcome.description: To compare the absolute change of serum uric acid levels from baseline levels

other_outcome.measure: Percent change of serum uric acid levels from baseline
other_outcome.time_frame: Every 1 to 4 weeks, up to 24 weeks
other_outcome.description: To compare percent change of serum uric acid levels from baseline levels

other_outcome.measure: Adverse Events, laboratory tests, vital signs, electrocardiograms, gout flare and pain assessment
other_outcome.time_frame: Every 1 to 4 weeks, up to 26 weeks
other_outcome.description: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of RDEA3170 in patients with gout or asymptomatic hyperuricemia
The number of subjects with gout flares will be summarized by treatment group.

other_outcome.time_frame: Every 1 to 4 weeks, up to 24 weeks
other_outcome.description: sUA-related efficacy variables (percent change in sUA level from baseline, absolute change in sUA level from baseline, sUA concentration) will be analyzed in terms of plasma RDEA3170 concentration.

other_outcome.time_frame: Every 1 to 4 weeks, up to 24 weeks
other_outcome.description: Urinary uric acid concentration, urinary pH and serum creatinine level will be analyzed in terms of plasma/urine RDEA3170 concentration.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject meets any of the following criteria and with sUA ≤10.0 mg/dL:
1. sUA level of >7.0 mg/dL at 7 days prior to baseline with gout;
2. sUA level of ≥8.0 mg/dL at 7 days prior to baseline without gout but with complications (hypertension, ischemic heart disease, diabetes, metabolic syndrome);
3. sUA level of ≥9.0 mg/dL at 7 days prior to baseline without gout and complications.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject with an acute gout flare that has not resolved at least 14 days prior to the baseline visit.
- Subject has a history or suspicion of kidney stones.
- Subject has an estimated creatinine clearance <60 mL/min calculated by the Cockcroft Gault formula
- Subject is receiving strong or moderate CYP3A inhibitors
